buildings.blessing: The priest walks in circles around your holding an incense lamp and chanting something quietly. After the ritual the $associatedNPC.firstName tells you that the blessing succeeded, but they do not know what the blessing is.
buildings.guardReadout: This church is protected by rusted metal statues.
buildings.aboutReadout: Within this holy place they pray to one god primarily, but other gods occasionally or for specific petitions. The temple itself was originally dedicated to the Sword-Prince and is known for a collection of relics.
buildings.interiorReadout: You enter the cavernous, tidy church and notice a large urn with mythological paintings going all around it. The main room is triangular in shape and is decorated with mostly aristocratic looking holy art. The interior walls of the church are a colorful structure of painted wood and plaster and the the ceiling is vaulted. The church was designed by a noble who wanted to show how holy he was and it is simple with a large annex; the annex contains many chambers.
buildings.tippyDescription: A cavernous and tidy church that is dedicated to the Sword-Prince

buildings.fun: A shady looking gnomish inventor is proudly showing off his latest invention. He calls it a one armed bandit.

game.name: Two-Up
game.description: A small crowd of people are gathered around a table, where two people flip two coins in the air, with one <<profile $npcs[$building.gamer.key] $building.gamer.descriptor>> groaning whenever they both turned heads, and another <<profile $npcs[$building.gameBanker.key] $building.gameBanker.descriptor>> greedily grabbing the coins from the man in charge of overseeing the bets whenever they both turn tails, flicking the overseer a copper for his troubles.
game.rules: Two coins are flipped by the 'spinner', who bets against another. Both heads wins, both tails loses, and one of each calls for another cointoss, with the 'spinner' losing out on five consecutive re-tosses.

buildings.drawFeature: You see a patron enter the bar from the sleeping quarters. The bartender asks if she slept well, and she nods at the thick, in a muscular sense man, saying that she slept very well.
buildings.entertainment: There is a juggler up on the wide stage currently juggling three large rocks.
buildings.feature: All of the tables in the tavern have an assortment of sauces created by the tavern cook.

town.currentEvent: an anniversary of an important event

guard.name: The Careful Defenders
guard.leaderQualification: able to rise to power by completing an ordeal
guard.leaderBribes: will never be accepted, and will be met with instant excommunication

leader.name: Corrin Jamjar
leader.descriptor: diminutive man with very narrows hips
idle: sitting, with a piece of bread in hand
chewing on a piece of hay
sharpening the blade on a fearsome looking dagger
cutting an apple into bite sized pieces
eating an apple while looking at some book
eating a hunk of cheese while reading a book
sipping out of a huge mug while reading a book
leader.title: Mr
leader.professionOrigin: I suffer from wanderlust, so I found the life of the ranger to be freeing; to me, wandering without a fixed home is freeing.
leader.backgroundOrigin: From a young age, I couldn't abide the stink of cities, and sought out the wilderness for respite from the chaos of people.
leader.bond: I am the last of my tribe, and it is up to me to ensure their names enter legend.
leader.ideal: It is each person's responsibility to make the most happiness for the whole tribe.
descriptors: mid thirties halfling with very narrows hips
tan skinned diminutive halfling
diminutive male halfling with very narrows hips
diminutive man with very narrows hips
bony male halfling
bony halfling man
leader.sexuality: predominantly prefers the same gender, but finds other genders attractive
leader.professionSuccess: Corrin is a ranger<><><>

guard.stabilityCause: the lack of infighting for the leadership role
guard.joiningInitiation: a simple form to be filled
guard.tippyDescription: A slightly above average sized rangers guild called The Careful Defenders

mountaineer.description: a person living in a mountainous area.
mountaineer.name: mountaineer

cleric.description: has devoted their entire being to the will of their god, thus gaining magical powers.
professionOrigin: My god called on me to serve the faith as a cleric, so I abandoned my previous life, and set out for the nearest temple.
I saw the injustice and horrors of the world, and felt that I couldn't live without trying to do something about it.
My god gave me a sign that I was needed to do something important, some time in the future. I'm still waiting for my time to serve, but when it happens, I'll be ready.
I've always been devout, but it wasn't until I completed a pilgrimage to a sacred site that I found my true calling.
I used to serve in the beauracracy of the church, but found the work unrewarding. Being able to spread the message to the farthest corners of the land is much more satisfying work.
cleric.name: cleric

professionOrigin: I wanted to hone my combat skills, and so I joined a war college
I  grew up fighting, and I refined my talents by defending myself against people who crossed me.
I squired for a knight, who taught me how to fight, care for my steed, and conduct myself with honor. I decided to take up that path for myself.
Monster attacks led me to believe that there was no other way for me to be able to defend my family.
I joined the army, and learnt how to fight in a group as a team against a common enemy.
I always had a knack for just about any weapon which I picked up.
fighter.name: fighter

monk.description: a warrior of a holy order.
professionOrigin: I stumbled into a portal and took refuge in a strange monastery, where I learned how to defend mysel fagainst the forces of darkness.
I was chosen to study at a secluded monastery, where I learnt the fundamental techniques to set me on the path to eventual mastery.
I sought out the instruction of a monk to gain a greater understanding of my world, and my purpose in it.
I was overwhelmed with grief when I lost my sister, and found solace in meditation with the monks.
I always felt a power within me, and sought out an order of monks to help me understand it and harness that energy for good.
I was wild, and undisciplined as a child, until I realised the error of my ways. I sought out the monks to atone for my sins.
monk.name: monk

professionOrigin: I've always been nimble and quick of wit, so I decided to use those talents to help me make my way in the world.
A thief wronged me, so I focused my training on mastering those skills to better combat foes of that sort.
Know thy enemy. I aim to learn everything there is to know about the Thieves' guild, and then I'll bring it all tumbling down.
An experienced rogue saw something in me, and taught me several useful tricks.
I took up with a group of ruffians, that taught me how to get what I want without direct confrontation.
I'm a sucker for a shiny bauble or bag of coins, as long as I can get it without risking life and limb.
I just love the thrill of the heist. There's nothing that makes me feel more alive than taking something from right under someone's nose.
rogue.name: rogue

ranger.description: wanders or ranges over a particular area or domain.
professionOrigin: I always had a way with animals, and was able to calm them with a gentle touch and soothing word.
I found purpose while I was honing my hunting skills by bringing dangerous beasts down from the outskirts of civilisation.
I suffer from wanderlust, so I found the life of the ranger to be freeing; to me, wandering without a fixed home is freeing.
I met a grizzled ranger who taught me the secrets of woodcraft and surviving in the wild.
I served in the army, and led my division by scouting ahead, blazing trails and tracking our enemies.
ranger.name: ranger

paladin.description: a holy knight and divine spellcaster crusading in the name of their god.
professionOrigin: A magical being appeared before me, and called on me to undertake a holy quest.
One of my ancestors left a holy quest unfulfilled, so I seek to rectify this.
The world is a dark and terrible place. I seek to be a beacon of hope for those that may not have the courage to go on otherwise.
I served as a paladin's squire, and admired his honesty and conduct. I decided to follow in his footsteps, and champion the good and decency that he represented.
Evil must be opposed on all fronts, and I decided to be the first line of defense against such scum.
Becoming a paladin was a natural consequence of my unwavering faith. I saw the need for the faith to be protected with sword and shield.
paladin.name: paladin

actor.description: impersonates characters, typically on stage in a theatrical production.
professionOrigin: I always loved playing make-believe; this is just the natural result of that.
actor.name: actor

advocate.description: practices or studies law, typically an attorney or a counselor.
professionOrigin: I have always had a strong moral compass, and wanted to defend those that I thought needed defending.
advocate.name: advocate

advisor.description: advises some sort of government official on a specific area of governing.
professionOrigin: Becoming an advisor was simply a matter of being in the right place at the right time.
advisor.name: advisor

animal handler.description: works with different animals for a variety of tasks, typically livestock.
professionOrigin: I have always had a knack for animal handling.
animal handler.name: animal handler

apothecarist.description: prepares and sells medicines, drugs, and potions.
professionOrigin: I was taught apothecary at a young age.
apothecarist.name: apothecarist

architect.description: designs buildings or landscapes and in many cases supervises their construction.
professionOrigin: I had an apprenticeship, drafting up plans for houses. I made improvements to my master's plans. Now, I do it for a living.
architect.name: architect

archivist.description: maintains and is in charge of some sort archives.
professionOrigin: I love ordering things, and archiving suits me perfectly.
Everything being in its place suits me very well.
I have an amazing memory, and can find what someone is looking for almost instantly.
archivist.name: archivist

armorer.description: specializes in making and repairing armor.
professionOrigin: I did an apprenticeship and fell into armoring as a result of that.
armorer.name: armorer

astrologer.description: uses astrology to tell others about their character or to predict their future.
professionOrigin: I loved the stars as a kid, and made a career out of it.
astrologer.name: astrologer

baker.description: makes all sorts of baked goods.
professionOrigin: Early risers like me are well suited to the life of a baker.
I love bread!
Watching yeast rise is meditative.
baker.name: baker

banker.description: an officer or owner of a bank or group of banks.
professionOrigin: I love money, so wanted to work as somebody that would be in charge of money.
banker.name: banker

barber.description: cuts hair and shaves or trims beards.
professionOrigin: I have a steady hand, and like to think that I am a good conversationalist- barbering was a natural fit.
barber.name: barber

bartender.description: pours drinks at taverns and other establishments.
professionOrigin: I came across the tavern as a youngster, and spent many a night here drinking with my buddies. When the old owner died, it went to auction, and I tried to kep the dream alive by buying it. One by one all my friends grew out of it, or moved away.
Before I ran the tavern, it was my dad's. I kept the family business going to support him in his old age.
When I first got here, it was practically a ghost town. We built the tavern as a social hub for the folk, and it's now what it is today.
The old owner was a problem gambler, and when they auctioned off the tavern, I jumped at it.
The old owner thought that the tavern wasn't profitable. In the first six months of my stewardship, I turned it around, and have made it the best bloody pub in $town.name!

Running the tavern was the family business, and it was always going to be my lot in life. I'm not angry or disappointed or anything, but I would like to see the world one day, and it stops me from doing that.
I was just a kitchen hand when this place started. The owner and I worked through thick and thin, and when his daughter died, he had nobody to leave it to, except for me.
My parents bought this place as an investment. I don't know what they were thinking- when have you ever heard of a pub being profitable?
bartender.name: bartender

barmaid.description: serves drinks and food in a bar as well as engaging with customers.
professionOrigin: Bar work has been all that I have been able to find.
barmaid.name: barmaid

blacksmith.description: forges and repairs things in metal, including weapons, armor, utensils, etc.
professionOrigin: I was an apprentice in the smithy, and took up the title when my old master passed on.
I was a tinkerer, and just drifted from town to town doing odd jobs for people until I came to $town.name. I fell in love with the place, and then settled here.
I followed my love here, set up shop, and now we're happily married, with a steady job and a roof over our heads.
My father was a blacksmith before me, and then I took up the trade to make him proud. Or at least, I hope I've made him proud. He passed before I opened up shop.

I was an apprentice, and my old master bitterly despised me because my father married his love. I worked so hard to perfect my craft to impress him thinking that the issue was with me, and then the bastard had a heart attack. Left everything to her. What's my mum gonna do with a smithy?!
I spent a lot of time in the mountains with the Dwarves, and they taught me a thing or two while I was there.
blacksmith.name: blacksmith

blacksmith's assistant.description: serves under a blacksmith learning the trade of forging.
professionOrigin: I'm doing an apprenticeship, I hope to be a full blacksmith one day.
blacksmith's assistant.name: blacksmith's assistant

bookseller.description: sells books from a shop or cart.
bookseller.name: bookseller

professionOrigin: I started out as a hobbyist, but then went fulltime.
brewer.name: brewer

brickmason.description: builds with mineral products such as stones, bricks, cinder blocks, or tiles, usually with the use of mortar as a bonding agent.
brickmason.name: brickmason

pimp.description: controls prostitutes and arranges clients for them, taking part of their earnings in return.
professionOrigin: Being a pimp is all about connections- it's all about who you know. With good clients comes good money.
pimp.name: pimp

buccaneer.description: a kind of privateer or free sailor.
buccaneer.name: buccaneer

professionOrigin: I had an apprenticeship, and have been butchering ever since.
There's nothing quite like a nice sausage, right? Well, I'm picky, and like sausages my way.
butcher.name: butcher

captain.description: an army officer of high rank in charge of commanding squadrons of soldiers.
professionOrigin: I rose through the ranks, receiving awards for my bravery during battle, eventually landing at the position of captain.
captain.name: captain

caravanner.description: travels or lives in a caravan.
caravanner.name: caravanner

carpenter.description: makes and repairs wooden objects and structures.
carpenter.name: carpenter

cartographer.description: a scholar and illustrator of maps.
professionOrigin: I love maps, and have a good hand for drawing. Cartography is the natural intersection of the two.
cartographer.name: cartographer

chef.description: a professional cook trained in the culinary arts.
chef.name: chef

clergyman.description: a member of the clergy attached to a private chapel, institution, ship, branch of the armed forces, etc.
clergyman.name: clergyman

cooper.description: makes and repairs casks and barrels.
cooper.name: cooper

courtesan.description: a prostitute with wealthy and noble clients.
courtesan.name: courtesan

courtier.description: attends court as a companion or adviser to the king or queen.
courtier.name: courtier

dancer.description: moves their body rhythmically with or without musical accompaniment.
dancer.name: dancer

diplomat.description: an official representing a country abroad.
diplomat.name: diplomat

domestic partner.description: a spouse that stays at home, cooking, cleaning, and caring for the family.
domestic partner.name: domestic partner

farmer.description: operates a farm or cultivates land.
farmer.name: farmer

general.description: the chief commander of an army.
general.name: general

gladiator.description: fights against other people, wild animals, or monsters in an arena.
gladiator.name: gladiator

guard.description: a person who keeps watch, especially a soldier or other person formally assigned to protect a person or to control access to a place.
professionOrigin: Keeping the peace is easy enough. Might as well get paid for it.
guard.name: guard

guildmaster.description: leads an economically independent producer (a â€œguild,â€ an association of craftsmen or merchants that often holds considerable bureaucratic power).
guildmaster.name: guildmaster

healer.description: able to cure a disease or injury using magic.
healer.name: healer

herald.description: a messenger who carries important news.
herald.name: herald

herbalist.description: practices healing by the use of herbs.
herbalist.name: herbalist

hermit.description: lives in solitude, typically as a religious or spiritual discipline.
hermit.name: hermit

historian.description: an expert in or student of history, especially that of a particular period, geographical region, or social phenomenon.
historian.name: historian

hunter.description: hunts game or other wild animals.
hunter.name: hunter

inventor.description: invented a particular process or device, or invents things as an occupation.
inventor.name: inventor

jailer.description: supervises a jail and the prisoners in it.
professionOrigin: I know that jailing is not a pretty profession, but somebody has to do it- might as well be me, right?
jailer.name: jailer

jeweller.description: designs, makes, and repairs necklaces, bracelets, rings, etc., often containing jewels.
jeweller.name: jeweller

judge.description: decides cases in a court of law.
judge.name: judge

knight.description: serves his or her sovereign after being bestowed a rank of royal honor.
knight.name: knight

leatherworker.description: makes items from leather such as pouches, scabbards, straps, etc.
leatherworker.name: leatherworker

librarian.description: administers or assists in a library.
librarian.name: librarian

linguist.description: studies the essence of communication, including the units, nature, structure, and modification of language.
linguist.name: linguist

lumberjack.description: fells trees, cuts them into logs, and transports them to a sawmill.
lumberjack.name: lumberjack

maid.description: a domestic servant of a household.
maid.name: maid

professionOrigin: I grew up poor. I learnt to hock stuff off to feed myself.
Some people just have the gift of the gab- I have a talent for sales.
I love gold. Unashamedly, I really do. So what? Selling is an honest living. Sue me.
I spent my youth selling whatever scraps I could find, never got tired of it.
merchant.name: merchant

professionOrigin: I was always good at running- being a messenger was a natural extension of that.
messenger.name: messenger

midwife.description: assists in childbirth and the care of women giving birth.
professionOrigin: I have always loved children, and can't bear the thought of a woman being alone during childbirth.
midwife.name: midwife

miller.description: owns or works in a grain mill.
miller.name: miller

miner.description: works underground in mines in order to obtain minerals such as coal, diamonds, or gold.
miner.name: miner

minister.description: assists with the administration of business.
minister.name: minister

minstrel.description: recites lyric or heroic poetry for nobility.
minstrel.name: minstrel

friar.description: a member of a religious community of men, usually a cloistered one, potentially living under vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience.
friar.name: friar

mortician.description: prepares dead bodies for burial or cremation and makes arrangements for funerals.
mortician.name: mortician

necromancer.description: communicates with and conjures the spirits of the dead.
necromancer.name: necromancer

nun.description: a member of a religious community of women, usually a cloistered one, potentially living under vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience.
nun.name: nun

nurse.description: cares for the sick or infirm, especially in a hospital.
nurse.name: nurse

painter.description: paints pictures using a variety of different substances.
painter.name: painter

patissier.description: maker or seller of pastries and cakes.
patissier.name: patissier

philosopher.description: a scholar of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.
philosopher.name: philosopher

politician.description: holding or seeking office in government.
professionOrigin: I dared to dream that I could change the world, and rise above the others.
I became furious with the corruption in politics, so I decided to enter the rat-race myself.
I thought that I could do a better job than the last guy. I was right.
politician.name: politician

potter.description: makes pots, bowls, plates, etc., out of clay.
potter.name: potter

priest.description: has the authority to perform certain rites and administer certain sacraments.
professionOrigin: I heard the calling of priesthood from a very young age- my path was never in question.
I was initially going to be a chef- but then, one day, I felt the urge to go to church. I've never looked back.
priest.name: priest

privateer.description: engages in maritime warfare under a commission of war.
privateer.name: privateer

professor.description: a teacher of the highest rank in a college or university.
professor.name: professor

rugmaker.description: makes and repairs rugs by braiding, hooking, weaving, etc.
rugmaker.name: rugmaker

sailor.description: works as a member of the crew of a commercial or naval ship or boat.
professionOrigin: I can handle the rough seas, and the pay is alright, so here I am, a sailor.
I don't like the sea all that much, but the pay is okay.
I love the sea, and would feel homesick on land. The sea is where I belong.
sailor.name: sailor

sculptor.description: crafts art by carving or casting blocks of marble, stones, or other hardened minerals.
sculptor.name: sculptor

scavenger.description: searches for and collects discarded items.
scavenger.name: scavenger

seer.description: able to see what the future holds through supernatural insight.
seer.name: seer

professionOrigin: Believe it or not, I didn't exactly hope to be a servant- terrible hours, awful pay, and having to work for some stuck up noble? Ugh.
Being a servant was all the work that I could find.
servant.name: servant

shaman.description: accesses and influences the world of good and evil spirits.
shaman.name: shaman

professionOrigin: Being a shepherd is easy enough- sheep are good company, if you take the time to get to know them.
shepherd.name: shepherd

shoemaker.description: makes shoes out of different materials.
shoemaker.name: shoemaker

silversmith.description: a smith who specializes in precious metals.
silversmith.name: silversmith

slave.description: a person who is the legal property of another and forced to obey them.
professionOrigin: I was born into slavery; this is the only life that I have ever known.
I was forced into slavery.
I was sold into slavery after being captured.
slave.name: slave

conscripted soldier.description: serves in an army against their will.
conscripted soldier.name: conscripted soldier

squire.description: acts as an attendant to a knight before attempting to become a knight themselves.
squire.name: squire

stevedore.description: loads and unloads cargo from ships.
stevedore.name: stevedore

stonemason.description: cuts and prepares stone for use in construction.
stonemason.name: stonemason

steward.description: supervises both the estate and household of his lord or lady while they are away.
steward.name: steward

surveyor.description: establishes maps and boundaries for ownership or other purposes required by government or civil law.
surveyor.name: surveyor

tailor.description: makes, alters, repairs, as well as occasionally designing garments.
tailor.name: tailor

tanner.description: treats the skins and hides of animals to produce leather.
tanner.name: tanner

professionOrigin: Selling goods is easy enough. Selling for a profit? That's harder.
shopkeep.name: shopkeep

shopkeep's assistant.name: shopkeep's assistant

teacher.name: teacher

thief.name: thief

professionOrigin: I don't expect you to understand why I'm a torturer. It's a job, alright?

weaver.name: weaver

professionOrigin: I sell my body for what it is worth. It is what it is- at least it's just an innocent baby.
wetnurse.name: wetnurse

animal/Monster Handler.name: animal/Monster Handler

deities.name: Zeus
deities.description: Zeus is the leader of the Greek gods, and lives atop Mount Olympus, where he rules over the mortal world below.
deities.appearance: Zeus is depicted as a regal, mature man with a sturdy figure and dark beard grasping a lightning bolt and wreathed in a crown of olive leaves.

quotes.description: Bear up, my child, bear up; Zeus who oversees and directs all things is still mighty in heaven.
quotes.author: Sophocles

combat.title: Military Prowess
combat.description: Zeus famously led the Greek gods in the battle against the Titans, and is a fearsome foe. He calls down electric energy and fashions them into mighty spears of lightning to hurl at his enemies.

children.title: Aegis
children.description: The Aegis bears the head of a Gorgon, and makes a terrible roaring sound in battle.

deities.realm: Olympus, where he rules over all.

followers.description: Zeus is followed by many, of all different race and creed.

children.title: Oaths
children.description: A promise or an oath is a sacred bond that should not be broken.

deities.name: Poseidon
titles: God of the Sea and Earthquakes
deities.description: Poseidon is the god of the Sea - all things underwater are under his purview
deities.appearance: a mature man with a sturdy build and a dark beard holding a trident and a sea-creature encrusted boulder, simply crowned with a headband with a cloak draped around his arms.

children.title: Poseidon's Trident
children.description: Poseidon's trident was so powerful that it could shake the lands.

deities.realm: a palace underneath the sea, watching over the fishermen from below.

followers.description: Poseidon is followed by many mariners, fishermen, and horse riders.

children.title: smooth sailing
children.description: Poseidon will bless sailors and those that have earnt his favour with smooth passage.

children.title: management of horses
children.description: As the Lord of Horses, Poseidon can calm equines as easily as he can enrage them.

children.title: mad horses
children.description: As the Lord of Horses, Poseidon can enrage equines as easily as he can calm them.

children.title: stormy seas
children.description: Those that tempt Poseidon's wrath risk stormy seas on their next voyage.

deities.name: Hades
deities.description: Hades is the god of the Dead and the first son of Kronos. However when He, Zeus and Poseidon were drawing lots for the division of the cosmos, Hades gained dominion of the Underworld, where he rules over the dead.
deities.appearance: a dark-bearded, regal god, with a bird tipped sceptre with Cerebus seated by his throne.

children.title: Sceptre
children.description: A powerful relic that is able to create a passage between the worlds of the living and the dead

children.title: Cap of Invisibility
children.description: A cap which can turn the wearer invisible

deities.realm: the Underworld. As far below the earth as the heavens are above, Hades' realm is a dark and depressing place.

followers.description: Hades, as the god of the dead, was a fearsome figure to those still living; in no hurry to meet him, they were reluctant to swear oaths in his name, and averted their faces when sacrificing to him. Since to many, simply to say the word "Hades" was frightening, euphemisms were pressed into use.

children.title: second to last day of every month
children.description: Rituals are typically held on this day.

children.title: plenty from the earth
children.description: As the lord of the underworld, Hades has considerable wealth, and can bestow riches to those he deems worthy.

children.title: the ability to go un-noticed
children.description: Hades can give those that wish to be unseen the power to avoid detection in the dark.

deities.name: Aphrodite
deities.description: Aphrodite is the goddess of love and scorns those who stay away from relationships. Her love can be a thing of beauty or a thing of terror and destruction.
deities.appearance: Aphrodite is consistently portrayed as a nubile, infinitely desirable adult, having had no childhood.

children.title: A Darker Side
children.description: While Aphrodite is most well known as the goddess of Love, she is also known as a goddess of War - especially by people like the Spartans.

children.title: Girdle
children.description: The Girdle inspires desire in all those who look upon the wearer

followers.description: As the goddess of beauty and love the favour of Aphrodite was worshipped by all people, though especially by prostitutes.

children.title: the fourth day of every month
children.description: Rituals are typically held on this day.

avatars.title: Aphrodite Areia
avatars.description: Aphrodite Areia is a war-like aspect of Aphrodite. She appears clad in armour and bearing weapons and is worshipped by the Spartans and other war-loving people. Aphrodite is ready to use deciptive strategies, such as how she lured the Gigantes one by one into a cave for them to be murdered

deities.name: Artemis
titles: Goddess of the Flocks and the Chase
deities.description: Artemis is the goddess of the Hunt and young girls. She can change others into animals as punishment for transgressions against her and she demands appropriate respect from mortals.
deities.appearance: a young woman wearing a short costume that leaves her legs free and wielding a bow with a quiver of arrows.
portfolios: sudden death and disease of girls

children.title: A Dangerous Hunter
children.description: Artemis is quick to strike down those who offend her with animals and wild beasts. She is a dedicated huntress and will pursue her quarry until it is caught.

children.title: Bow of Artemis
children.description: The Bow of Artemis was forged by the Cyclopses

followers.description: Artemis is worshipped by Hunters and Women, young girls could be expected to serve Artemis until they come of age.

children.title: the sixth day of the week
children.description: Rituals are typically held on this day.

children.title: chastity
children.description: Artemis and her followers value chastity above all else.

children.title: transformation into a wild animal
children.description: As goddess of the hunt, Artemis can transform those that wrong her into wild animas to be hunted.

deities.name: Apollo
deities.description: The twin brother of Artemis, Apollo is the inventor of music. Those that he loves and loses or those that he hates can find themselves transformed and immortalised as a part of nature.
deities.appearance: a handsome youth, beardless with long hair and holds either a lyre or a bow.
portfolios: sudden death and diseases of boys

children.title: The Lyre of Apollo
children.description:
When Hermes was a baby, he stole a number of Apollo's Cattle and took them to a cave in the woods near Pylos. In the cave, he found a tortoise and killed it, then removed the insides. He used one of the cow's intestines and the tortoise shell and made the first lyre. 
 Apollo eventually found Hermes, but fell in love with the sound the lyre made. Apollo gifted the cattle to Hermes in exchange for the lyre and forgave Hermes for stealing his cattle.

children.title: Bow of Apollo
children.description: The bow of Apollo fires arrows and plagues upon those who anger him

followers.description: Oracles are often followers of Apollo, the Greatest of which is the Pythia of Delph, the high priestess of Apollo

deities.name: Athena
titles: The Contriver of Plans and Devices
deities.description: Athena is a wise goddess and protects those that follow her. She does have the rage of a goddess, and affronts to her are paid back with divine retribution.
deities.appearance: a stately woman wearing a helmet armed with a spear and Aegis

followers.description: Athena is the goddess of Craftsment, Wisdom and Heroes.

deities.name: Dionysus
deities.description: Dionysus is the god of Wine and Theatre, his revelry is open to all. However, he has his dark side - he is the god of madness the anger of Dionysus is a terrifying thing
deities.appearance: long haired youth, almost effeminate in appearance. He holds a staff topped with a pinecone and brings revelry with him

followers.description: Dionysus is a god of the people and youths. Those who value proper decorum and modesty are apallled at the revelry of the Bacchic crowds. Devotees of Dionysus may engage in the rending of animals with their bare hands

children.title: Eighth Month of the Year
children.description: Rituals are typically held on this day.

deities.name: Demeter
deities.description: Demeter is the goddess of Agriculture - her favour promised a bountiful harvest and more grain then could be eaten. However her anger promised frosts and famine.
deities.appearance: a mature woman wearing a crown holding wheat in a cornocopia and a torch

followers.description: As the goddess of Agriculture, Demeter has a dedictated following among anyone who farmed. She was also a major figure of worship in the Eleusinian mysteries, which promised a better afterlife to its followers.

deities.name: Hermes
deities.description: Hermes is the hessenger of the gods and the personal messenger of Zeus. He brings the souls of the deceased to the edge of the underworld, where they are ferried deeper by the Cthonic gods
deities.appearance: an athletic man wearing winged boots, full of energy. Ontop of his head is a helmet with two wings attached.

children.title: Talaria
children.description: Tarlaria is the name of a pair of winged boots forged by Hephaestus.

children.title: Golden Blade
children.description: His weapon was a sword of gold, which killed Argos; lent to Perseus to kill Medusa.

children.title: Winged Helm
children.description: A Petasos with wings, Hermes' helmet was forged by Hephaestus.

followers.description: Hermes was the messenger of Zeus, and his followers were all those that valued speed. Additionally, travelers, traders, and thieves worshiped him.

relationships.name: Aphroditus
relationships.description: Aphrodite gave birth to Hermaphroditus, or Aphroditus, the god of androgyny.

deities.name: Hera
deities.description: Hera is the Queen of the gods, forever tested by her husband Zeus. Unable to attack Zeus, her anger is often directed to his consorts or his children.
deities.appearance: a beautiful woman wearing a crown and holding a royal, lotus-tipped sceptre

relationships.name: Hephaestus
relationships.description: Hera gave birth to Hephaestus without male intervention.

deities.name: Ares
deities.appearance: always clad in armour, holding weapons and ready for battle. He can appear as the fresh-faced youth or the grizzeled veteran depending on his mood.

children.title: Odikinesis
children.description: Possessing the ability to manipulate feelings and emotions of war such as hate and rage, Ares would induce strife before battles.

children.title: Strength
children.description: As a fighter, Ares excelled at all to do with physicality.

children.title: Bloodlust
children.description: As the God of War, Ares has plenty of experience in battle. In contrast to Athena, who is the goddess of tacticians, Ares represents a more brutal, carnal type of conquest.

followers.description: Ares is the god of war and courage - cities and countries going to war would worship Ares before going into battle

deities.name: Hestia
deities.description: Hestia is the First-born child of Kronos and Rhea and the first to be swallowed by him. After Apollo and Poseidon vied for her hand in marriage she refused and chose to be an eternal virgin.
deities.appearance: a beautiful veiled woman, with long dark hair

children.title: De-escalation
children.description: Hestia finds combat distasteful, and will try and defuse the situation before it gets out of hand.

deities.name: Hephaestus
deities.appearance: bearded man with twisted legs

followers.description: Hephaestus is the god of the forge. He is worshipped by Craftsmen and his blessing gives them inspiration and skill,

deities.name: Persephone
deities.appearance: a beautiful young maiden with fair skin. Her face is the epitome of young beauty. She is often shown in long, flowing clothing with a wreath of flowers around her head.

followers.description: Persephone was a goddess of Spring and the Wife of Hades. Her favour might ensure a better afterlife for her worshippers.

deities.name: Hecate
deities.appearance: a woman wearing a crown. Sometimes, she has three bodies, conjoined to one another.

followers.description: Hecate is a mysterious Goddess who is a master of the Arcane Arts and lives in the Underworld, her followers ask for her secret knowledge.

deities.name: Nike
deities.appearance: an athletic woman with two large wings.

followers.description: The Favour of Nike is a promise of victory, though it was rarely given without being earnt.

deities.name: Tyche
deities.appearance: a woman with a crown, often shown holding a horn of cornucopia.

deities.name: Hebe
deities.description: Hebe is the daughter of Zeus and Hera, as well as the Goddess of Youth. She served as the Cupbearer of the Gods, and was later married to Herakles, the protector of Olympus.
deities.appearance: a woman in a sleeveless dress, with long brown hair.

children.title: Fountain of Youth
children.description: Hebe was the protector of the Fountain of Youth.

followers.description: As the bride of Heracles, Hebe was strongly associated with both brides and her husband in art and literature. Hebe was the patron of brides, due to being the daughter of Hera and the importance of her own wedding.

children.title: Restored Youth
children.description: A power unique to Hebe, she was able to restore youth to mortals.

relationships.name: Hera
relationships.description: Hebe helped Hera enter her chariot.

deities.name: Pan
deities.appearance: a satyr holding a set of Pan-pipes

deities.name: Asclepius
deities.description: Asclepius is the son of Apollo whose skill in medicine was so great he could ressurect the dead, he was struck down by Zeus. He was placed among the stars and now serves as the Physician for the gods
deities.appearance: a man with a full beard in a simple himation robe.

followers.description: Asclepius was so skiled in medicine that he could ressurect the dead, Healers and the Sick pray for his favour for skill and recovery

deities.name: Chiron
deities.appearance: a centaur, though in some iterations his front legs are human legs.

followers.description: Chiron is worshipped by Heroes and Centaurs alike for his wisdom and control.

deities.name: Heracles
deities.description: The Son of Zeus who famously completed 12 Labours, Heracles ascended to godhood and is known as the greatest of the Greek Heroes
deities.appearance: a muscular man with a beard
deities.symbol: olive-wood club and lion skin cape

followers.description: Arguably the greatest of Heroes, Heracles is worshipped by mortals for his strength and fame

deities.name: Ariadne
deities.appearance: a woman with a laurel crown
